<<<<<<< HEAD
Staffords Niobe: or His age of teares A treatise no lesse profitable, and comfortable, then the times damnable. Wherein deaths visard is pulled off, and her face discouered not to be so fearefull as the vulgar makes it: and withall it is shewed that death is only bad to the bad, good to the good. Stafford, Anthony.
[20], 201, [1] p.
Printed by Humfrey Lownes, At London : 1611.
Page 134 misnumbered 116. Considerable print show-through. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Wherein deaths visard is pulled off, and her face discouered not to be so fearefull as the vulgar makes it: and withall it is shewed that death is only bad to the bad, good to the good. Stafford, Anthony.
[20], 201, [1] p.
Printed by Humfrey Lownes, At London : 1611.
